creditline: Gift of Don and Bev Smith
text: After developing a serie of molded plastic chairs, the Eameses turned to fiberglass. the "DAR" Chair was among the first plastic furniture to be truly mass-produced. Inexpensive, lightweight, and versatile, it was especially popular with young families in the post-war period. The shells were coupled with a wide variety of bases, including the "Eiffel Tower" wire strut seen here.
title: Plastic armchair with "Eiffel Tower" base
